item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello World!!! My name is Cleyton and I’m a Data Scientist and Ph.D. Candidate in Economics at Universidade Federal de Pernambuco here in Brazil. I’m very passionate about technologies, computers and data. I spend most my time in front of my computer working on a dataset or learning coding instead of studying for exams (kkkkkkk). My main interests relies on data analysis, specially machine learnign, big data, and econometrics. Thanks for stepping by!

item.title: Using Julia for Data Science
item.description: This a quick introduction to the Julia programming language and will be presented to you how you can work rightaway with datasets with Julia. Why Julia? Julia is a high level programming language released in 2012 by a team of MIT researchers. Since its beginning, the aim was to solve the so called two-language programing problem: easy to use functionalities of interpretable languages (Python, R, Matlab) vs high performance of compiled languages (C, C++, Fortran).

Work in Progress “Let there be more light: The impact of headlamp law on road accidents.”, with Leonardo Melo, Giuseppe Trevisan and Breno Sampaio. Work in Progress, January 2019. “Commodity prices and business cycles in emerging economies: The role of news shocks”, with Marcelo Eduardo A. da Silva. Working Paper, July 2017.
